text: So there's a small issue with the SuiteSparse GraphBLAS binary builder on Yggdrasil. SuiteSparse GraphBLAS is now a somewhat separate library, with its own GitHub repo that is simply bundled with the larger SuiteSparse library. The issue is that SuiteSparse isn't updated as often as the GraphBLAS repo is. Ordinarily I would just point the script to the new repo, but the version number would then be behind, since GraphBLAS is younger. What should be done in this situation. Obviously waiting for the maintainer to update SuiteSparse is a possibility, it's done fairly regularly. But that leaves the jll noticeably behind quite often.

text: sorry, I'm not sure I follow.  you're talking about <https://github.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/blob/master/S/SuiteSparse/SuiteSparseGraphBLAS/build_tarballs.jl>, right?

elements.text: sorry, I'm not sure I follow.  you're talking about

text:
Yes. You can see it's built from the archives of the SuiteSparse GitHub repo. The script 'cd's into a subfolder of the (larger SuiteSparse) libraries main directory to build GraphBLAS. 

Dr. Davis maintains SuiteSparse GraphBLAS as a separate repo and copies the code into this directory. We are using the copied subfolder which is behind the main repo version wise
